alert.note: Alert for Dewey; Major; Woodward (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 09 at 8:09AM CDT until further notice by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Norman OK has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Oklahoma... North Canadian River near Seiling affecting Dewey, Major and Woodward Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...North Canadian River near Seiling. * WHEN...From this morning until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 12.0 feet, Croplands... pastures... oil wells... and rural roads are flooded. Areas affected extend from the southwest corner of Major County... downstream to the headwaters of Canton Lake in Dewey County. Cattle and other property should be relocated to places which are at least 1 foot higher than nearby river banks... to avoid being isolated for several hours by water in side channels. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:00 AM CDT Sunday the stage was 10.7 feet. - Bankfull stage is 11.0 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise above flood stage this morning to 12.1 feet this evening. It will then fall below flood stage late tomorrow morning to 9.3 feet Tuesday morning. It will then rise above flood stage again early Wednesday afternoon. - Flood stage is 11.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 815 PM CDT.
